entry.title: Married At First Sight LA
entry.summary:
Author: tinypeckers

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,303Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 28

Summary: Is love a scientific anomaly? This is what the experts of Married of First Sight LA are trying to test in this new reality TV show where strangers are matched to each other based on their personalities, likes and dislikes.Will these hopeful newlyweds find true love amongst the drama? Or will this experiment prove too much for some of our couples? Find out this season on Married At First Sight LA!  Tags will be updated alongside the story.

entry.title: [podfic] ice cream before dinner
entry.summary:
Author: nuuma

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: Missing Chris is less of an emotion these days and more of a physical entity. He’s sure everyone can see that he’s slowly hollowing himself out, that he can’t do much of anything else.But when Jee laughs at him trying to get his tongue to touch his nose, and Mara loops one of her arms through his to keep him from tossing the rest of his cup in the garbage, Eddie feels solid again.Maybe he likes yellow birthday cake ice cream after all. (or, gerrard messes with the team's schedules and eddie 'i just drove my son to flee the state' diaz is the only option to watch mara and jee-yun after school on tuesdays, which, shouldn't be a problem at all, right?)

entry.title: and if it all ended tomorrow (would I be the one on your mind?)
entry.summary:
Author: poetvienna

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,690Chapters: 2/5Kudos: 11

Summary: Buckley has always believed his life was defined by loneliness and abandonment. The emptiness in his heart and the burden of his own presence became constant companions, and every attempt to find love seemed destined to fail. But one night changes everything.An unexpected revelation after a night of secrets sets Buck on an emotionally devastating journey. He finds himself in love with Eddie Diaz—his best friend, someone he has always considered his family. Yet fate, cruel in its unpredictability, delivers another blow: Buck discovers he’s expecting a child, the result of something Eddie doesn’t even remember.As Eddie plans a new life in Texas, Buck is left to grapple with the chaos of his own truth: to fight for a love he has never dared to confess or to accept the lonely path that feels like his destiny. Amid the storm of emotions, his courage will be tested, and the weight of secrets may change everything.

entry.title: Everyone's Moved On (Help I'm Still at the Restuarant)
entry.summary:
Author: thekookiesmeow

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,139Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 133

Summary: “Why does it feel like you’re telling me goodbye?” Eddie whispers, staring into the depths of his husband’s eyes. “Because I am” It’s meant to be light, a joke but it lands heavier than either of them wants. Because it’s true. Buck was being drafted again, and as Eddie watches him walk down their walkway, he fears he’s never going to feel whole again.What happens when a mission goes wrong and a husband loses his partner and their son loses his dad? What happens when someone starts showing interest in Eddie and who on Earth keeps knocking at the door?

entry.title: deep in the heart of texas
entry.summary:
Author: meriwethersays

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,456Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 185

Summary: Eddie thinks, fuck it, he’ll give up one tip to talk. “How long have you been together?” His voice is strangely rough, even though he’s seen plenty of goodbyes since he’s been driving.Marvin looks startled for a minute. “Six years,” he says. “Three long-distance.”“That must be hard.”Marvin nods, and there’s a kind of miserable longing on his face. “We facetime as often as we can, but—”“It’s not the same,” Eddie finishes, and feels unaccountably sad.Marvin nods again. “It’s not even the sex, you know? I mean, obviously I miss that too, but it’s just—waking up in the same bed with someone, or going for a walk at night—”“People do look at you strangely if you walk in the street while facetiming,” Eddie agrees. Not that he and Buck ever woke up in bed together or went for a late-night walk, unless you counted both waking up in their bunks at the firehouse when the bell went off, or staggering from the firehouse to their cars, and why should he be thinking of Buck at all?

entry.title: everything we never said
